intro: Campylospermum wallichianum, commonly known as the Himalayan campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
